text: The film is actually good: details from the beggining that we just dont get too much attention develops the story and makes the film more exciting, and the tension part is the best, which define a good thriller drama. The only trash was the final, which I expected to be more surprising and have a good reflection but it was the opposite, so if there was a good final, maybe it would be 5 stars, but because of this, im giving four stars
It was pretty good but was pretty convoluted near the end. I'd never bother to watch it again. Watch it if there's nothing else on.

This is an awesome movie with lots of twists. It’s really creative, with the entire movie being a recording from a screen. June (Storm Reid) did an amazing job bringing emotions to life with her mother’s (Nia Long) disappearance. Great storyline, love it!

Missing (2023) compellingly explores the power of the digital world, showing how easily personal information can be accessed and used for both good and evil. The story effectively builds tension through a unique computer screen perspective, keeping viewers engaged despite some pacing issues and plot inconsistencies. With strong performances and an unpredictable plot twist, the film offers a modern thriller that highlights the dark and bright sides of technology.

Read the full review here: (Indonesian version : alunauwie.com)

It's a fine thriller, but Searching 2: Missing ultimately feels like a rehash of its predecessor. While it maintains a gripping mystery, it lacks the raw emotional intensity of John Cho's performance in the first film, making it feel more like a formulaic retread than a true evolution of the concept.

With the omnipresence of technology in the world today, it seems like movies such as Missing could become a regular occurrence. There’s plenty of reasons to be irritated by the gimmick, chief among which being that it doesn’t feel very cinematic. Fortunately, Missing maintains a brisk pace and throws in enough twists and turns to keep you invested and guessing. Some of the reveals later on throw up more questions than answers, and it starts to feel like the film just wants to confuse and baffle you as much as possible. Also, the villains plan is ridiculously convoluted and it unfolds in the middle of a film that takes great pains to demonstrate how pretty much anything and anyone is trackable on the internet if you’re determined enough, which means it makes even less sense. That being said, it’s a movie that zips by, never dragging or wasting too much time, and the characters are well acted enough to make you care about them. If you can get past the fact that you’re literally watching screens on a screen, then it’s very enjoyable time.
turned it off after the first eye roll, that girl can't act.

Genuinely amazing. From the plot twists to the overall style of the film, I loved every second. Only being able to see what's going on through the use of cameras and phone screens, and the growing tension as our lead slowly unearthed this mystery, made for an incredibly immersive thriller that'll surely keep you on the edge of your seat. Highly recommended watch!!!
Very nice and also mysterious. Never knew what was next.

This is how you make a who done it movie the plot twists are so insanely good and Storm Reid was so good as well her acting was phenomenal I wished I would’ve seen this in the theaters this is definitely the best who done it movie to ever exist I definitely recommend this.

OH MYYYY.. AMAZINGGG!! Twists were nice it kept me watching as someone who gets bored easily. And the characters were easy to fall in love with. The feature of the Netflix show was nice but also not really need, it didn’t ruin the movie though!!

Very thrilling well-made movie. I enjoyed so much and I felt it's like 3 hours long because it packed with many twists. Almost perfect but just one thing... all the visual effect and tricks are only possible in this internet-age, so it might be look aged badly in some years in future.

Absolutely love this movie, love the way they made this movie. Definitely different way to shoot a movie. But I loved it so much! If you haven't seen this movie, please I would recommend watching this movie. 🔥😊
